interview_questions.question: What is the purpose of the `<body>` tag in an HTML document?
interview_questions.answer: The `<body>` tag contains all the visible content of a web page, such as text, images, links, tables, lists, and forms.
interview_questions.explanation: Everything you see rendered in the browser window is inside the `<body>` tag. Only one `<body>` element is allowed per HTML document.

interview_questions.question: How do you include forms for user input in the body?
interview_questions.answer:
Use the `<form>` tag with various input elements:

```html
<form>
  <label>Name: <input type="text" name="username"></label>
  <input type="submit" value="Submit">
</form>
```
interview_questions.explanation: Forms allow users to send data to a server.

interview_questions.question: How do you add multimedia elements (audio/video) to an HTML body?
interview_questions.answer:
Use the `<audio>` and `<video>` tags:

```html
<audio controls>
  <source src="sound.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">
</audio>
<video controls width="320" height="240">
  <source src="movie.mp4" type="video/mp4">
</video>
```
interview_questions.explanation: The `controls` attribute adds play/pause buttons for users.

interview_questions.question: How do you organize page sections or group content for layout inside the body?
interview_questions.answer: Use semantic tags like `<header>`, `<nav>`, `<main>`, `<section>`, `<article>`, `<aside>`, and `<footer>` to group and organize content.
interview_questions.explanation: Semantic tags improve accessibility, SEO, and code readability by clearly describing the purpose of each section.
